author: happiechappie
content: Hi, I am working on a stake pool manager and during onboarding of a validator we collect presigned voluntary exit messages and store them(encrypted messages) in a database. So whenever we want to exit, we can decrypt and broadcast. Will presigned voluntary exit messages expire at any point of time? Is there any other attack vectors or issues which we need to consider?

author: jgm
content: They expire after two hard forks.  They also can't be created until the validator is recognized on-chain, so can't be created at time of deposit.
